items.to_string:
Value statement: As a MLOps developer and tenant, I need to ensure that the Exam Verification Domain in PreProd is fully operational so that users can develop on SageMaker.

AC: Ensure that the PreProd domain passes the validation script. Run the LCC attachment script, then run the domain validation tests. All tests relevant for EVA should pass.

Value Statement: As a MLOps developer, I need to ensure that EVA's repository and development progress meet the criteria for PreProd promotion to avoid obstacles in the transition to the PreProd domain.
 AC: Ensure that the EVA codebase and other tooling meets the requirements listed in the PreProd deployment readiness checklist. Some criteria may not apply to EVA, so best judgement should be used to determine what needs to be met.

items.from_string: Evaluate EVA repository for PreProd promotion readiness to prepare for PreProd promotion
items.to_string: Evaluate Exam Verification Agent repository for PreProd promotion readiness to prepare for PreProd promotion

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI Mlops Engineer who is automating pulling in and writing back data into VBMS, I need the ability to have the Automated Document Annotations team view an updated table with bert scores so that they gain awareness on the quality of generated summaries.

Acceptance Criteria: -When a user accesses the VBMS "annotations summary" table, the user has the ability to see automatically updated bert scores (via Lambda or another service). -The tenant or BIP-AI team can read bert scores in the annotation summary table. - Successful runs of automated lambda (service of choice) invocations

Acceptance Criteria: -When a user accesses the VBMS "annotations summary" table, the user has the ability to see automatically updated bert scores (via Lambda or another service). -The tenant or BIP-AI team can read bert scores in the annotation summary table. - Successful runs of automated lambda (service of choice) invocations

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI Mlops Engineer who is automating pulling in and writing back data into VBMS, I need the ability to have the Automated Document Annotations team view an updated table with bert scores so that they gain awareness on the quality of generated summaries.

Acceptance Criteria: 
 * A viable solution for writing the BERT similarity score back to the originating VBMS database is identified and documented.
 * The solution demonstrates technical capability to update the VBMS database table with the calculated BERT similarity score.

Value Statement: As a MLOps developer, I need to configure slack notification to the SRI's team channel so that they are aware when their pipeline is done running daily. 
AC: Ensure that SRI is able to receive real time notifications in their slack channel once the pipeline has run. Verify that this is correctly configured and that the message is clear once the pipeline has ran indicating if it was successful or if it failed.

Values Statement: As a MLOps engineer I want to be able to build the TERA endpoints in a secure CI/CD process. This process should create endpoints that can be promoted to upper environments.

AC - CI/CD process built that creates TERA endpoints in dev - (Ideally this CI/CD process can be created in stage and preprod time permitting)
This issue is cloned by BIP-28488

items.from_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-28488
CI/CD for new TERA process built and tested in all environments ( TERA does not really use stage due to their data locations )
items.to_string: Create script for CI/CD TERA process

AC - CI/CD process built that creates TERA endpoints in dev - (Ideally this CI/CD process can be created in stage and preprod time permitting)

Values Statement: As a MLOPs engineer I need a script that can create an endpoint that can be run as part of the TERA CI/CD process
AC: PR of script in feature branch, screenshot of endpoint created with script

Value statement: As a MLOps developer I need to be able to monitor the health and performance of the TERA endpoints. Since TERA has had to remove much of their logging for performance considerations this ticket is to look at how the endpoints can be monitored with little to no logging. This may be similar to how SPA is setting up their monitoring as well.

AC: - Try to set up some test monitoring and alerting in the dev or preprod environment - Document what monitoring of the API gateway /endpoints is possible

items.from_string: Monitoring / Alerting set up for TERA endpoints
items.to_string: Research Monitoring / Alerting set up for TERA endpoints

Value Statement: As a ML engineer I want to add pytests to the SPA CI/CD pipeline to create automatic testing for the lambda work being done so changes will be tested before release.

AC: Pytest for the lambda added to be run during github CI/CD.

Value Statement: As a ml engineer, I want to create a release and deployment strategy for SPA so that a clear guideline is in place for the first deployment so both teams are on the same page.

AC: Release created and BIP AI deployment guideline is documented for SPA team.

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I need to create AWS resources in the EVA PreProd domain so that the EVA team can continue begin development in the PreProd Sagemaker environment.

AC: All necessary EVA resources are created in PreProd. Resources have been tested with EVA scripts. Permissions and other settings are configured to allow resources to function

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant/SE, I would like to test the creation of Lambdas using IaC so that Lambdas can be created in a more efficient manner (instead of using Console)

AC: The created Lambda functions as it does in lower environments

Value Statement: As a Solution Engineer in MLOPS, I need to validate access to eMPWR dev domain and confirm that eMPWR team members have access.

Acceptance Criteria: Successfully validate access to eMPWR dev domain and confirm that eMPWR team members have access.

Value Statement As a BIP AI Solutions Engineer, I want to research and document the eMPWR Intelligent Automation use case for Limited Pay letter processing so that I can provide a comprehensive technical solution using Bedrock Data Automation (BDA) that reduces manual processing time, improves accuracy, and enables automated document field extraction for the eMPWR tenant.

Acceptance Criteria:

AC1: Architecture Options Analysis • Document Nova Pro only, Claude 3.5 only, and dual-model architecture options • Analyze performance, cost, and complexity trade-offs for each approach • Provide clear recommendations with pros/cons for eMPWR team consideration • Document findings in Confluence with architecture diagrams and decision matrix

AC2: Cost Comparison & Documentation • Calculate monthly costs for each architecture option (Nova only, Claude only, dual-model) • Present cost-benefit analysis to enable eMPWR team decision making • Create Confluence documentation with detailed cost breakdowns and assumptions • Include scaling scenarios and cost projections for different processing volumes Definition of Done Provide documentation in Confluence of all BDA architecture options with detailed cost comparisons and performance analysis to support their architecture selection decision.

Value Statement As a BIP AI Solutions Engineer, I want to research and document the eMPWR Intelligent Automation use case for Limited Pay letter processing so that I can provide a comprehensive technical solution using Bedrock Data Automation (BDA) that reduces manual processing time, improves accuracy, and enables automated document field extraction for the eMPWR tenant.

Acceptance Criteria:

AC1: Architecture Options Analysis • Document Nova Pro only, Claude 3.5 only, and dual-model architecture options • Analyze performance, cost, and complexity trade-offs for each approach • Provide clear recommendations with pros/cons for eMPWR team consideration • Document findings in Confluence with architecture diagrams and decision matrix

AC2: Cost Comparison & Documentation • Calculate monthly costs for each architecture option (Nova only, Claude only, dual-model) • Present cost-benefit analysis to enable eMPWR team decision making • Create Confluence documentation with detailed cost breakdowns and assumptions • Include scaling scenarios and cost projections for different processing volumes Definition of Done Provide documentation in Confluence of all BDA architecture options with detailed cost comparisons and performance analysis to support their architecture selection decision.

Value Statement As a BIP AI Solutions Engineer, I want to research and document the eMPWR Intelligent Automation use case for Limited Pay letter processing so that I can provide a comprehensive technical solution using Bedrock Data Automation (BDA) that reduces manual processing time, improves accuracy, and enables automated document field extraction for the eMPWR tenant.

Acceptance Criteria:

Document the following in Confluence:
 * eMPWR Limited Pay letter automation use case and workflow analysis in Confluence

*AC2:* Document Bedrock Data Automation technical solution architecture and API specifications in Confluence

*AC3:* Document cost analysis comparing Nova Pro vs Claude 3.5 Sonnet models with recommendations in Confluence

*AC4:* Document step-by-step BDA project creation guide via AWS console in Confluence

*AC5:* Document implementation roadmap and deployment steps for eMPWR team in Confluence

*AC6:* Document ROI analysis and measurable improvement metrics in Confluence

*AC5: Measurable Improvements*
 * ✅ 90% processing time reduction quantified
 * ✅ ROI calculation with cost savings
 * ✅ Automated field extraction validated

Value Statement As a support engineer who operates SPA’s serverless endpoints, I need the ability to receive timely alerts on Lambda and API Gateway health so that I can respond quickly to errors, latency spikes, and throttling before users are impacted.

Acceptance Criteria - When a Lambda function deployed by SPA in dev, test, and prod experiences Errors, an alert is sent to the designated notification channel. - When a Lambda function’s Duration exceeds a configured threshold, an alert is sent. When a Lambda function encounters Throttles, an alert is sent. - When API Gateway reports errors, an alert is sent. - When API Gateway reports Latency exceeding a baseline, an alert is sent. - Alerts are delivered to an SNS topic wired to: Slack This story is dependent on the completion of: “SPA monitoring” (baseline dashboards/metrics discovery) and a KT on tenant alerts as done on team.

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer building out the claims evidence API MCP, I want to facilitate a meeting with the Claims Evidence team in order to understand the full functionality of the API and any gaps with existing MCP.

AC: Documentation created of gaps between existing tools and potential tools, use cases for each of the tools, and tickets created to fill those gaps.

items.from_string: Facilitate KT with CE team for additional tooling requirements
items.to_string: Facilitate knowledge transfer with Claims Evidence team for additional tooling requirements
BIP-27997 Support C&P MCP adoption (oracle, CE MCP)

## Story As an ML engineer, I want the default IAM policies applied to SageMaker execution roles to be logically split and refined so that I have sufficient character capacity to customize and test tenant-specific permissions without hitting AWS policy size limits. ## Acceptance Criteria - Given the current foundation sagemaker-primary policy when I measure its size then it is below 80% of AWS IAM policy limits (below 4,915 characters for inline, 8,192 for managed) - Given the current foundation sagemaker-aux-services policy when I measure its size then it is below 80% of AWS IAM policy limits - Given the current foundation bedrock-primary policy when I measure its size then it is below 80% of AWS IAM policy limits - Given the inline policy in sagemaker-domain-role-composition when I measure its size then it is below 80% of the 6,144 character AWS inline policy limit (below 4,915 characters) - Given any custom tenant policies when I measure their combined size with base policies then total policy attachment count remains within AWS limits (10 managed policies per role) - Given the refactored policies when applied to existing SageMaker execution roles then all current functionality is preserved - Given a tenant customization scenario when I add permissions to test new services then I have at least 20% capacity remaining in the relevant policy ## Definition of Done - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit + integration) - Documentation updated with new policy structure - Policy validation scripts added to measure current sizes - Security and access controls reviewed - All existing tenant deployments verified functional after policy changes

Value Statement: As a Infra engineer I need to prototype the setup and deployment of the KB provider, so that we can perform CRUD operations on KBs with Crossplane

A/C: - Adapt and setup KB provider with custom providerConfig - Test KB provider with our architecture

items.from_string: Prototype KB Provider to perform CRUD operations
items.to_string: Prototype Knowledge Base Provider to perform CRUD operations

Value Statement:

**As an BIP-AI member, I need a new EntraID Group created for the RBAC Saga to properly manage access control and permissions for BIP infrastructure components.**

**A/C:** - Track a new EntraID Group from VA, which will form the basis for cluster permissions for the infra team. Follow the established naming convention and be integrated with the existing RBAC framework for BIP infrastructure. - When the EntraID Group are provisioned, more work will be done to integrate teh EntraID group in following stories.

## Story As a BIP-AI tenant, I want automated permissions to access my AOSS collections so that I can perform knowledge base operations seamlessly without manual IAM configuration. ## Acceptance Criteria - Given a tenant intake claim with collection IDs specified when processed then AOSS collection permissions are added to the bedrock inference profile policy - Given a tenant with both knowledge base IDs and collection IDs when the composition processes then both permission sets are included in the bedrock-ip policy - Given existing tenants with knowledge base permissions when the update deploys then no current functionality is broken and no resources are recreated or deleted - Given the bedrock-ip policy when updated then it supports both inference profiles and collection/knowledge base resource permissions - Given a production environment deployment when collection permissions are configured then the production composition supports collection IDs in addition to knowledge base IDs - Given a sandbox deployment with collection permissions when tested then tenants can successfully access their assigned AOSS collections for knowledge base operations - Given the intake definitions when updated then collection IDs are properly defined as an optional array parameter alongside existing knowledge base IDs ## Definition of Done - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated for collection permissions in sandbox environment - Documentation updated to reflect new collection ID parameter support - Intake definition schema updated with collection ID support - Composition logic updated to migrate KB and collection permissions to bedrock-ip policy - Claim templates updated to support collection ID specification - Production composition updated with collection ID support - Backward compatibility verified for existing deployments

## Story As a BIP-AI tenant, I want automated creation of inference profile policies for production roles so that I have mirrored permissions to access knowledge base resources and invoke inference profiles without manual policy configuration. ## Acceptance Criteria - Given a production environment deployment when tenant resources are created then an IP policy is automatically generated mirroring lower environment permissions - Given a production role without standard SageMaker domain resources when the composition processes then the IP policy provides equivalent access to knowledge base resources and inference profiles - Given lower environment IP policy permissions when production deployment occurs then the same permission set is replicated for production-specific resources - Given a sandbox environment when production resource creation is simulated then the IP policy creation logic functions correctly - Given production IP policies when created then they include permissions for inference profile invocation and knowledge base access matching lower environments - Given future agent functionality when implemented then the IP policy structure supports adding agent permissions without breaking changes - Given existing production deployments when IP policy automation is enabled then no current functionality is disrupted ## Definition of Done - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated for production IP policy creation in sandbox environment - Documentation updated to reflect automated production IP policy creation - Production composition updated with IP policy automation logic - Sandbox testing completed with simulated production resource scenarios - Permission parity verified between lower and production environments - Future agent permission structure prepared

Value Statement As a BIP AI infra engineer who design gateway app, I need the ability to add audit logs on the crossplane api so that mlops resource management activities through gateway app can be logged and traced to particular user. Acceptance Criteria 1 Add well formatted audit logs to each and every crossplane api. 2. Logs are stored in an audit log file. 3. Look into whether ARIA needs audit logging.

Value Statement As a BIP AI infra engineer who design gateway app, I need the ability to research log forwarding approaches so that I can design gateway log forwarding to Grafana for display. Acceptance Criteria 1 Research and recommend gateway app log forward approach to Grafana. 2. Generate or update related architecture diagram.

## Value Statement As a infra engineer who investigates the best way to resolve the system.js codeql issue by either trying to add it to the build package or host the packages on nexus as a CDN, I need the ability to future state is the codeql tool in github is no longer reporting this issue so that the codebase meets security standards. ## Acceptance Criteria When a user runs CodeQL security scans on the bip-ai-gateway repo, the user has the ability to see that the CodeQL scan no longer reports the critical systemjs error. None Documentation is updated None Automated or manual tests were added None

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer I need the ability to attach LCCs but not have the domain go into update failed. The LCC attachment script should have checks to make sure no legacy LCCs or deleted LCCs are attached if possible Acceptance Criteria: - Update the LCC attachment script to not allow legacy or deleted LCCs if possible

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who assists tenants, I need the ability to have updated documentation on how to create Bedrock Data Automation projects on AWS console so that the BIP-AI team can receive clear guidance on how to create projects Acceptance Criteria: - When a user requires guidance on creating Bedrock Data Automation projects in AWS console, the user has the ability to find clear and correct guidance in Confluence
This issue is cloned by BIP-28473

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer learning to implement strands and bedrock agents, I need a comprehensive example notebook and prototype that demonstrates how to create an agent using an existing lambda function, so that I can understand the integration patterns and demonstrate/document how to quickly implement similar solutions for other engineers. Acceptance Criteria: - When a user accesses the example materials, there is a complete strands notebook demonstrating agent creation. - The notebook includes step-by-step instructions for integrating an existing lambda function. - A working prototype is available that shows the end-to-end process- - The example covers common use cases and integration patterns. - Code is well-documented and includes explanatory comments - The example can be easily adapted for different lambda functions and use cases

Value Statement As a BIP-AI Mlops Engineer who monitors tenants reource usage and service activity in grafana, I need the ability to reference updated confluence documents with up to date context with what currently exists in grafana so that the BIP-AI team can quickly reference what the team currenly has in place in grafana. Acceptance Criteria - When a user views the confluence documentation, the user has the ability to see an updated confluence document. - Coherent and correct updated documentation with current grafana assets such as alerts or dashboards

Value Statement As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer working with the Reusable Agentic Framework (RAF) and Strands, I need comprehensive confluence documentation on the RAF page specifically for Strands usage. This will ensure that all team members can easily reference up-to-date information and guidelines on how Strands is utilized within RAF, promoting consistency and reducing onboarding time for new engineers. Acceptance Criteria - Confluence documentation exists on the RAF page covering Strands usage - Documentation provides clear instructions and context for Strands integration and application - Documentation is accessible to team members

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI Mlops Engineer who monitors Bedrock model invocations through inference profiles, I need the ability to have panels currently configured for model arns pointing to inference profile arns so that the BIP-AI team can accurately track inference profile usage. Acceptance Criteria: - Model invocation panels are configured to inference profiles instead. - Changes should be done across all tenant dashboards. - Documentation is updated yes, the grafana documentation in confluence

Value Statement As a BIP AI Engineer/Tenant, I need the ability to use the mlkit custom image in all Sagemaker domains so that the space starts up faster and the environment is more customizable to our liking AC When a user attaches an image, they're able to fully use mlkit (might need to make this more specific) mlkit image can be successfully used in all domains, and this can be tested by running the tenant_resources notebooks that use mlkit

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer working with MLKIT, I need a dedicated RAF section that includes bedrock agent modules and strands functionality so that I can run a notebook without manually installing necessary tools. Acceptance Criteria: - A new RAF section is created within MLKIT - Bedrock agent module is implemented with shortcuts to create agent action groups - Strands-agents, strands-agents-tools module is added to the RAF section and installed by LCCs - All modules are properly documented and accessible within MLKIT - The RAF section integrates seamlessly with existing MLKIT functionality - New shortcuts and modules for RAF development are made available for use in an .ipynb - May involve new release to MLKIT

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who updates Grafana with additional Bedrock monitoring metrics, I need the capability to achieve enhanced observability in Grafana regarding Bedrock token usage so that I can accurately monitor resource utilization and increase awareness. Acceptance Criteria: - When a user views the Grafana dashboard across tenants utilizing Bedrock, the user has the ability to see input tokens and output tokens per minute per inference - Grafana dashboards reliably and accurately display Bedrock token metrics segmented by inference profile. - Documentation is updated in Grafana documentation.

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who updates Grafana with additional Bedrock monitoring metrics, I need the capability to achieve enhanced observability in Grafana regarding Bedrock model usage so that I can accurately monitor resource utilization and increase awareness. Acceptance Criteria: - When a user views the Grafana dashboard across tenants utilizing Bedrock, the user has the ability to see both requests per minute and total requests made by inference profile. - Grafana dashboards reliably and accurately display Bedrock request metrics segmented by inference profile. - Documentation is updated in Grafana documentation.

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer who validates infrastructure-provisioned Bedrock agents, I need the ability to confirm that an agent created via IaC is functional and accessible so that tenants can reliably use it through notebooks or Aria. Acceptance Criteria: - When an agent is provisioned by the IaC pipeline, the user has the ability to validate its functionality and readiness. - The agent can be invoked successfully through a Jupyter notebook and via Aria, returning expected responses. - Required IAM roles, policies, and secrets are correctly configured and accessible.

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who optimizes inference calls from bedrock, I need the ability to reference a functional Jupyter notebook demonstrating batch inference usage so that I can efficiently onboard users and validate batch inference capabilities. Acceptance Criteria: - When a tutorial notebook demonstrating batch inference usage is created, users are able to learn and validate batch inference functionality. - A functional Jupyter notebook demonstrates batch inference usage

As a BIP AI engineer, I want the ML KIT Release pipeline currently implemented in Jenkins to be migrated to Harness as a Harness-managed pipeline AC: Harness pipeline is managed as YAML in the bip-ai-harness repo. All Jenkins pipeline stages and parameters are replicated, including: Branch selection, integration testing, skip failures, deploy to Nexus, and image build. Secure credential handling for Git, Nexus, and Docker/ECR. Conditional execution of stages based on parameters/environment. Final YAML is documented for usage and triggers. Pipeline passes tests and matches Jenkins logic.

As a BIP AI engineer, I want an automated image promotion pipeline so that container images can be reliably promoted from one environment (e.g., staging) to another (e.g., production) using Harness, ensuring consistency and auditability. AC: The pipeline should support promotion of container images based on tags, digests, or release criteria. The Pipeline should replicate behavior of the image promotion pipeline in jenkins and that used to exist within harness sbx

items.from_string: As a BIP AI engineer, I want an automated image promotion pipeline so that container images can be reliably promoted from one environment (e.g., staging) to another (e.g., production) using Harness, ensuring consistency and auditability. AC: The pipeline should support promotion of container images based on tags, digests, or release criteria. The Pipeline should replicate behavior of the image promotion pipeline in jenkins and that used to exist within harness sbx
items.to_string:
As a BIP AI engineer, I want an automated image promotion pipeline so that container images can be reliably promoted from one environment to another using Harness.
----
h3. *Acceptance Criteria:*
 *  Tag-based image promotion between Nexus registries (dev → stage)
 *  Docker-in-Docker pipeline implementation replicating Jenkins behavior
 *  Input validation and error handling
 *  Configurable source/target registries via Input Sets
 *  Pipeline YAML and documentation complete

----
h3. *Summary:*

Built fully functional image promotion pipeline using Docker-in-Docker approach. Pipeline pulls images from source Nexus registry, re-tags, and pushes to target registry using configurable Input Sets.

*Deliverables:*
 * Pipeline YAML with reusable variables
 * Input Set template for dev→stage promotions
 * Documentation and configuration examples

As a BIP AI engineer, I want the existing Crossplane composition for Jenkins IRSA roles to be adapted for Harness, so that Harness jobs can use IRSA in a consistent, manageable, and secure way in our application clusters. AC: - Resource names, descriptions, and tags in the composition are updated to reference Harness instead of Jenkins (e.g., `project-bip-ai-harness-<env>-role`). - OIDC trust policy is scoped to the Harness service account(s) (e.g., `system:serviceaccount:<namespace>:<harness-sa>`). - All IAM policies, permissions, and resource blocks remain unchanged, unless additional permissions are identified for Harness workflows. - A Kubernetes ServiceAccount manifest is created/updated to reference the Harness IRSA role using the `eks.amazonaws.com/role-arn` annotation. - Documentation is updated to clarify the IRSA workflow for Harness, including instructions for ServiceAccount creation and usage in Harness pipelines. Link to Composition: https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-infrastructure/blob/main/charts/compositions/templates/foundation/foundation-jenkins-support-composition.yaml
This issue is cloned by BIP-28472

As a BIP AI engineer, I want to host a session that demonstrates how to enable Slack alerting in Harness, so that I can configure notifications and alerts for my pipelines and deployments and keep relevant stakeholders informed in real-time. Acceptance Criteria: - Demonstrate how to create and configure notification rules for pipelines and deployments. - Share troubleshooting tips for common issues encountered during Slack integration. - Provide example use cases or scenarios where Slack alerts are valuable for team collaboration and incident response.

As a BIP AI engineer, I want the Lambda Deployment pipeline currently implemented in Jenkins to be migrated to Harness as a Harness-managed pipeline AC: Harness pipeline is managed as YAML in the bip-ai-harness repo. All Jenkins pipeline stages and parameters are replicated, with any redesign needed to work smoothly with the IaC for lambda creation implemented. Final YAML is documented for usage and triggers. Pipeline passes tests and matches Jenkins logic.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28304

items.from_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-28304

items.to_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-28474

As a BIP AI engineer, I want to dedicate time to learn the Harness platform, so that I can become proficient in its usage, understand its core concepts, and proactively identify and research any potential challenges or common problems I may encounter during setup and integration. AC: - Use this time to work through harness related problems and research/learn any harness capabilities that will be important to the story assigned.

As a BIP AI engineer, I want to dedicate time to learn the Harness platform, so that I can become proficient in its usage, understand its core concepts, and proactively identify and research any potential challenges or common problems I may encounter during setup and integration. AC: - Use this time to work through harness related problems and research/learn any harness capabilities that will be important to the story assigned.

As a BIP AI Engineer, I want to collaborate with the Harness team to add Solution Engineers (SEs) as admin users to their respective tenant projects, so that SEs have the appropriate permissions to manage, troubleshoot, and support the projects they are responsible for. AC: Identify all tenant projects and the corresponding Solution Engineers who support them. Coordinate with the Harness team to ensure SEs are assigned to the correct projects. Add each SE to their respective tenant project with admin-level permissions. Verify that SEs have full administrative access and can perform necessary actions within the project. Document the process for future onboarding of SEs to tenant projects. Notify SEs and relevant stakeholders once access is provisioned.
As a ml engineer I want current SageMaker pipelines to refresh github data to be put on a schedule so data is refreshed in aria AC: SageMaker pipeline is scheduled running weekly on its own

As a ML engineer I want to identify and move common functions and classes that aria is using to interact with bedrock into MLKit under a RAF section so code can be reused by team members and tenants AC: Common interaction patterns identified in ARIA New RAF class created with code moved over to MLKit

2. Investigate bedrock cloudtrail logs.
3. Research sagemaker monitor to design integration pattern to integrate bedrock logs.

items.from_string:
**Story:**
As a frontend developer working on the BIP AI platform, I need to modularize the All Resources view Vue.js components by extracting reusable functionality into separate components to improve code maintainability, enable component reuse across the application, and reduce the complexity of the main view.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Extract the main data table component into a separate reusable Vue file
- Modularize the pause functionality component for standalone use
- Extract the deep pause feature into its own component
- Create a separate component for the hard refresh functionality
- Modularize all modal components used in the All Resources view
- Extract any other reusable UI elements or utility functions into separate components
- Ensure all extracted components maintain their current functionality and behavior
- Update the All Resources view to import and use the new modular components
- Implement proper props and events communication between parent and child components
- Add appropriate component documentation and prop validation
- Maintain all existing CSS styling and responsive behavior

**Definition of Done:**
- All Resources view file length significantly reduced while maintaining full functionality
- Each extractable feature exists as an independent Vue component in separate files
- All modular components properly tested and validated in SBX environment
- No functionality lost during the modularization process
- Component props and events properly defined with TypeScript interfaces where applicable
- All new components follow Vue.js and project coding standards
- Pull request created with clear description of modularization changes
- Code review completed by team members with approval
- Pull request successfully merged to main branch
- SBX testing confirms all features work as expected post-modularization
items.to_string:
Value Statement:

As a developer on the bip-ai infrastructure team, I want an automated setup for a local development environment so that I can quickly bootstrap all required infrastructure tools and focus on development rather than environment configuration.


Acceptance Criteria:

Given a developer on MacOS, Windows, or Linux when they run the justfile install command then Minikube, ArgoCD, Crossplane, LocalStack, aws-adfs, and all supporting CLI tools are installed successfully
Given a developer on a GFE machine when they run the setup then the system automatically configures VA certificates for image pulling from Minikube
Given a developer on a BAH Mac when they run the setup then the system automatically configures Zscaler certificates for image pulling from Minikube
Given the justfile when executed then it pulls Crossplane provider image versions based on BIP's current provider list
Given a configured environment when a developer runs the start command then Minikube starts successfully with proper certificate configuration and memory (10000 minimum)
Given a running environment when a developer runs the stop command then Minikube stops gracefully without data loss
Given the setup process when dependencies need updating then a separate variable file can be modified without changing the justfile directly
Given the installation on BAH Mac and GFE Windows Linux VM when tested then all functionality works correctly on both platforms


Definition of Done:

All acceptance criteria met
Tests completed on BAH Mac and GFE Windows Linux VM
Documentation updated with setup and usage instructions
Variable file created for dependency management
Justfile created in bip-ai-developer repository with install, start, and stop commands
Cross-platform compatibility verified for MacOS, Windows, and Linux


Dependencies:

Access to bip-ai-developer repository
Test access to both BAH Mac and GFE Windows environments (Virtual Machine/VBox)
Machine must have Docker Desktop or runtime previously installed
Machine requires access to BIP DEV ECR repo / ePAS to pull Crossplane images
BIP-25959 Support Development of Smart Pension Automation Use Case

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages SageMaker Studio domains, I need the ability to ensure the LCC pipeline only applies the correct lifecycle configurations so that unwanted legacy settings do not persist.

Acceptance Criteria

When the LCC pipeline runs, only the intended lifecycle configurations are attached to tenant SageMaker Studio domains.
Manual validation: Confirm legacy LCCs are not re-applied after pipeline execution.
